data.title: Satisfy a fall craving with one of Sue's homemade soups!
data.text:
Sue runs a cute little café right in the heart of the Surprise City Hall complex.  You order at the counter and they'll either box up your food or bring it out piping hot to a table inside or outside on the Surprise municipal mall.  

Sue will cook up a tasty breakfast to order, a specialty pizza or Panini, or one of her signature sandwiches or salads.  But one of my favorite selections is Sue's homemade soups.  She makes them from scratch, and usually runs out of them before Thursday because they are so popular.  I just had a chicken noodle with corn soup that I hesitate to recommend, lest she run out even faster this week!

Sue runs her café with the quality of a high end restaurant, but the heart of a "Mom & Pop."

data.title: Not exactly what I expected but it was ok -
data.text: My husband and I like trying different places and saw the reviews so decided to try this location.  We both had the breakfast special for $4.99 - scrambled eggs, 2 sausage, hashbrown potato and toast.  It was filling, it was good, it was a good price, and the view was beautiful - but we probably won't be by again, think this location is more for the Surprise City government people.

data.title: Home cooking in a fun location.
data.text:
In the heart of City government, next to the City tennis complex and a covered parking lies the little jewel called City Cafe.  Sue makes weekly home made specials, great sandwiches to order and the best coffee and coffee drinks in town. You may sit outside under the trees or inside flooded with light and air conditioning...and you may run into the City Manager to boot!

Sue has created a pumpkin latte with real pumpkin for the fall;  her soups are delicious; she makes a yummy breakfast burrito that will hold you through the afternoon; she has her own creation called macaroni cole slaw that is a deli delight and she's always baking some sweet treat that will make you happy.  If you want a snack or breakfast or lunch ... you'll be happy if you stop by for some of of Sue's signature comfort food.

data.title: Very Good Food
data.text: This place used to be Fat Freddy's Cafe but is now Surprise City Cafe with new management.  The food is very good.  We went there for brunch and really enjoyed the food, coffee, and meeting the new owners.  I had the bagel breakfast sandwich--very filling and tasty.  My wife had the breakfast wrap with chorizo and I enjoyed the sample.  Every table had a small vase with real flowers.  The prices are very reasonable.  We will eat here again.

data.title: Very good cafe
data.text: This is a hidden gem! The menu has a great variety for breakfast and lunch. There are numerous egg dishes, sandwiches, and salads. The coffee (regular or decaf) is very good! There are 3 seating areas, 2 inside, one outside. The setting has a pretty view of the City Hall grounds and Communiversity campus with pretty flowers, bushes, and trees. The food portions are fairly large and are prepared fresh and made-to-order. The owner and servers are very courteous and friendly and go out of their way to provide good service. The omelets and chili/beef burrito are excellent.

data.title: Great Food and Coffee
data.text: My wife and I just discovered this place and wish we would have found it a long time ago.  It is located in the City Hall building in Surprise.  We have been there twice this week for breakfast and just love it.  Their veggie omelet and chili and beef burrito are delicious and they have flavorful coffee.  They have a good selection of specials for breakfast and lunch at a very low price.  The servers are friendly and polite and bring your food to your table after ordering at the counter.  They have plenty of seating inside and outside.
